alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Durham; Orange; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 7:06PM EDT until July 09 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN CHATHAM, SOUTHERN DURHAM, SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE AND CENTRAL WAKE COUNTIES... At 706 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. Flooding has been reported at Atlantic Avenue at Hodges. Creek levels continue to rise, including Crabtree Creek at Capital Boulevard and at Anderson Drive. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Wake Forest, Carrboro, Zebulon, RDU International, Morrisville, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, William B Umstead State Park, Falls Lake Boat Ramp, Rollingview Marina, Research Triangle, Falls Lake, Falls Lake State Rec Area, Bethesda and Gorman. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
